case_title: MUHAMMAD SHARIF and others vs DISTRICT OFFICER and others

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Sharif
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Bakhsh (son of Mahmood)
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Bakhsh (son of Allah Ditta)
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector

complaint_summary: Petitioners leased State land under Temporary Cultivation Lease Scheme but were denied proprietary rights due to lack of District Collector approval on auction proceedings.
investigation_summary: Petitioners' applications were rejected by District Collector citing absence of auction approval. Appeals were dismissed by EDO(R). Similar cases were resolved favorably for other lessees.
judgment_summary: Revision petitions accepted. Petitioners granted proprietary rights based on rule of consistency and fulfillment of scheme conditions. District Collector directed to process files and recover dues.
Decision_or_verdict: Petitions accepted; proprietary rights granted to petitioners.
legal_arguments: Petitioners were highest bidders and leased land in accordance with law.
Failure to obtain District Collector approval was fault of public functionaries.
Petitioners fulfilled all terms of the scheme and paid government dues regularly.
Rule of consistency applied based on similar cases resolved favorably.
assets: State land leased under Temporary Cultivation Lease Scheme
key_issues: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector
Application of rule of consistency in granting proprietary rights

maxims.Consistency: Two groups of persons similarly placed cannot be treated differently.

legal_terms.Proprietary Rights: Legal ownership rights granted to lessees under a scheme.

words_and_phrases.Rule of Consistency: Legal principle requiring similar treatment for similarly placed individuals.

summary_vector_notes: Revision petitions accepted due to rule of consistency and fulfillment of scheme conditions. Petitioners granted proprietary rights despite procedural lapses by public functionaries.
